The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.

Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: My french DEFINITELY improved. I'm coming from an unusual spot in this class in that I hadn't taken french for three years, but the fast-paced and cumulative nature of the class definitely was effective at getting my french back quickly.
Language skills especially my listening and speaking skills improved hugely

After taking French 140 I have developed a deeper understanding of different grammar mainly the subjunctive and relative pronouns. I also learned to express myself clearly in a french essay and provide an analysis of different texts.
I improved my comprehension of the French language as well as my speaking. I gained knowledge about French culture and history specifically about France during the second world war.
I wasn't able to speak a full, correct sentence in French at the beginning of the semester and at the end of it I was able to deliver a 15 minute presentation--FULLY IN FRENCH!
I developed my knowledge of french grammar aswell as my appreciation of french literature and culture.

My French knowledge definitely improved at a rapid rate throughout this course. In particular, the emphasis on conversation in class and presentations really helped improve my speaking skills, something I had been weak in before.

There is definitely a strong emphasis on speaking and culture, and not on vocabulary, which I enjoyed but that might not be for everyone. The class focused mostly on literature and being able to clearly explain yourself in french, which again I liked.
It's very intensive which is a strength in terms of your exposure to the language, but it means that the workload can feel a bit unrelenting

This course was taught through immersion which I believe is the best way to acquire a new language and particularly at this level it is important to continue engaging in French dialogue to improve our accents and command of the language. I only wish the class was longer! Often we had debates in class or discussions about the readings that could have gone in if it had not been for time constraints.

This class was extremely helpful in improving my abilities with the French language. Professor Burton was extremely creative, engaging, and supportive so that all of her students felt comfortable to speak in her class. She was always fair with grading and provided all the help that her students could possibly want or need.
it was strong. Only problem is that the workload is a lot

It is a strong and enjoyable course. Considering the amount of in class testing and the evaluations we did at the end of every module, it seems unnecessary to put so much emphasis on the final exam in the overall grading of the course.
The course is extremely well-organized, running like a well-oiled machine.

I would, if you're ready to put in the effort. This isn't a class you can just breeze through; if you are on the fence about whether you really would enjoy this class (and you don't have to take it) then I would recommend not taking it.
Only if you really like french
Yes - while it is a very full-on course you learn a huge amount, and your language skills improve massively

Yes. If you are a student with strong speaking abilities who needs to improve grammar this is the course for you as French 130 would be far too easy. I found that my AP French class prepared me well for this level because unlike other AP French classes my European teacher emphasized speaking and reading. However if you are a student that was taught AP French in English and arent a strong speaker this class may be difficult but I would recommend shopping anyways.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student because of the level of engagement that is required of the students in an encouraging supportive environment. For students looking to improve their French, this class is perfect and I looked forward to coming to class every day.
Yes.
Yes. Its an engaging and enjoyable course.
I would definitely recommend it. Its a great way to learn a lot of French very quickly, and the readings and research are very interesting.
